clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Efficacy Between Suggestion Method During Video EEG Recording by Verbal Suggestion in Isolation and Verbal Suggestion Along With Cotton Swab or Tuning Fork for Inducing the Paroxysmal Event in Children Aged 5 to 18 Years With Suspected Psychogenic Nonepileptic Events
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Efficacy Between Suggestion Method During Video EEG Recording by Verbal Suggestion in Isolation and Verbal Suggestion Along With Cotton Swab or Tuning Fork for Inducing the Paroxysmal Event in Children Aged 5 to 18 Years With Suspected Psychogenic Nonepileptic Events

lead_sponsor.agency: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi

clinical_study.source: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi

brief_summary.textblock: In this study we are going to compare efficacy between suggestion method during video EEG recording by verbal suggestion in isolation and verbal suggestion along with cotton swab or tuning fork for inducing the paroxysmal event in children aged 5 to 18 years with suspected psychogenic nonepileptic events. Still there is paucity of data regarding the optimum method for video EEG by suggestion for psychogenic nonepileptic events. We are planning to recruit 25 children aged 5 to 18 years in each of the three arms after taking informed consent from the guardian and then they will be subjected to video EEG by any one of the three suggestion methods.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Open labeled, randomized controlled Non-inferiority study with three parallel arms: video EEG with verbal suggestion only, cotton swab with verbal suggestion and tuning fork along with verbal suggestion

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of children in each group, in whom the paroxysmal event could be reproduced by suggestion
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of children in each group, in whom the paroxysmal event could be induced by suggestion

intervention.description: Video EEG with verbal suggestion will be done by attaching EEG electrodes to the child along with verbals suggestion in isolation or verbal suggestion and tuning fork, verbal suggestion and cotton swab.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Children between 5 and 18 years of age with suspected diagnosis of psychogenic nonepileptic events -
Exclusion Criteria: Children with paroxysmal events, who will be later diagnosed as having epilepsy or movement disorder
